intro: Astrotrichilia rakodomena, commonly known as the Madagascar star-leaf tree, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade. Its botanical features make it a sought-after specimen in horticulture and botanical gardens.
